metadata.name: Inertia #821
metadata.description:
This project will be reserved and free for 48 hours, for all the holders of any of my projects!

The amount of reserves for each user will be equal to the amount of all the token held at 13:00 CEST [UTC+2] (May 23)
(example: user holds 3 "Figment" and 2 "ACCUMULATOR", will be able to mint "Inertia" 5 times)

48h from now I will update the reserves list and burn the remaining tokens

WARINING: The reserves will expire 48h after the drop! And a price for the unlocked mintables will be set (unreserved mints will not be free).

---

"Inertia is a property of matter by which it continues in its existing state of rest or uniform motion in a straight line, unless that state is changed by an external force."

Particles are blasted from 2 to 4 sides of the canvas, each particle has its own mass and it has to traverse a friction-field, once it loses its momentum completely it stops and leaves a trace, adding or subtracting light from the canvas.

The friction-field has 18 possible mutation kinds.
Mutations are high-friction zones of various shapes.

Made just with JS on a canvas
right-click to save

metadata.name: Triangle Subdivisions #430
metadata.description:
A study on geometric triangle subdivisions resulted in this artwork.
Only 638 bytes of JavaScript are needed to create a variety of different subdivisions (and no libraries are used). 

One tile will be generated for every byte of code.  

An article about this technique can be seen here:
https://josvromans.com/blog/2021/1/triangle-subdivisions/

metadata.name: Negative Space #373
metadata.description:
In this piece, special attention is paid to negative space, which is emphasized by simple / bold color palettes.

6 different styles
- Network
- Parachutes
- Flow
- Limbs
- Arcs
- Florals

9 different color palettes
- dark
- light
- yellow
- blue
- red
- green
- blue and yellow
- red and blue
- multi

Press any key to download a hi-res png.

p5.js script with a custom shader. Depending on the settings, it take some time to fully render / draw.

metadata.name: Nouveau Dillsack #108
metadata.description: You have awakened to discover a proboscum on your mageflap. While this may be frightening at first, once you let go a radiant warmth envelops you - @presstube - James Paterson - fxhash genesis 🌟

metadata.name: Heat Death #555
metadata.description:
Heat Death is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

It aims to produce variation and detail from minimal logic.

The source code uses p5.js and consists of around 180 lines of code. It has been left unminified for the interested viewer to learn more.

metadata.name: Euphonic #292
metadata.description:
Euphonic is an exploration of the emergent visual properties that arise from placing layers of simple lines atop one another.

In general this effect is called the Moiré effect. This effect really feels best in the tactile - when you have a printed page and an acetate sheet. This piece attempts to recreate that tactile joy.

This is built in WebGL 2 and so doesn't work in Safari 14 and below. All latest browsers will work as expected.

Licensing: BY-NC-ND see license.md for details.

metadata.name: Chaos Culture #721
metadata.description:
"Chaos Culture" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

《西遊記》第一回:「混沌未分天地亂，茫茫渺渺無人見。」

Chaos Culture is the final chapter of this series. There is a legend in the East that before Pan Gu opened up the sky and created the earth, the world was a chaotic place, and no one knew its appearance. And I have always been fascinated by this mythical story since he was a child.

These three works have a father-son relationship, Research > Memory > Culture, with each work re-growing through the remnants of the previous work, depending on its image. From the beginning of the creative coding, I like the concept of recursion the most. Here I experiment with my central thinking through this iterative relationship so that the work is not only the shadow of the artist but also the pulling force of repetition.

"混沌" Chaos in Eastern culture represents the initial state of things. This state is consistent with what we believe in generative art: Anything can happen if different forces are applied. Letting chaos grow out of order and then destroying it, the iterative process, is like my usual dialogue with myself, and maybe it's all just a diary.

Through these three series of works, whether I can eventually find everything in my childhood fantasy, I am not sure yet. The only thing I can be sure of is that I will continue to explore.

- Click the mouse to save an artwork.
- Collectors who own this NFT have the right to print the work.

Artist: Aluan Wang (ileivoivm).
Made with p5js and glsl.

metadata.name: Pixel Dinos #74
metadata.description:
Mint your own little dinosaur pet!..

Contains thousands of different combinations.

metadata.name: Breeding Grounds #263
metadata.description:
Social Networks.
Molecular Clouds.
Neuronal Circuitries.
Quantum Mechanical Structures.

Blurring Boundaries.
Infinite Self-Similarities.

Total.
Mess.

Perfect.
Order.

/////
Each element (besides the painting ground textures) is based on the underlying subdivided grid which is sometimes exposed like some kind of preliminary drawing.

Note on the split:
After seeing some of the outputs, Sermin had a dream about “Breeding Grounds” and I decided to incorporate events and feelings from her dream into the project. That's how the names of the color palettes came about. Thank you for naming them, Sermin!

Press 's' to save a .png with the current resolution (2000x3000).
If you want a file with higher resolution and/or without the “Painting Ground Textures” for printing please contact me via Twitter or Discord. 

/////
Created with p5.js

Twitter: @serminmin / @pxlshrd

metadata.name: Mythologic #328
metadata.description:
"Mythologic" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

Mythologic is a project derived from cloud series, Cloud Atlas and Requiem: Cloud on fxhash. In the series, lines and circles are used in an organics movement like Cloud Hands, which is a move of Tai Chi. Practitioners move their hands slowly and smoothly, make circles and rotate with extreme concentrating. In Chinese we said “floating clouds and flowing water” to describe calligraphers’ freely flowing style of writing. Chi is a very important for oriental artists, and for genart as well. In the series, lines and circles start from one position to another, and develop with organic rotations and movements, like practicing Tai Chi on the canvas. 

Mythologic was inspired from “Classic of Mountains and Seas”, also known as Shan Hai Jing, is a Chinese classic text and a compilation of mythic geography and beasts. 

“There is a beast that looks like a fox with nine tails.” 
“Huangbei: it is a beetle with meat like a tadpole, but with a head and a tail” 
“The beast has the body of a fish but the wings of a bird” 

There are many incredible creatures in the text which describe the oriental fantasy. The idea of Mythologic is to present an illustrated handbook with random generated paintings, each one is like a framed badge, to memorize the glorious age. It uses the "cloud hands" technique in every parts of this piece, the center, the circle and the frame. They are all the same algorithm but perform variety with different density and components. Gold, Silver, Copper, Jade and Ruby colors as noble symbol of treasure in Chinese culture. 

This project use p5js. 

Press 'S' to save pictures.

Thanks to the support of Yi-Wen Lin in this project.

metadata.name: Herbarium #230
metadata.description:
"Herbarium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Occasionally, I stumble upon vintage scientific illustrations on various topics, exotically looking charts and graphs, alternative layouts for the periodic tables or psychological research diagrams, elaborate illustrations of botany and zoology, minerals, and natural and sometimes unnatural phenomena. Most of those illustrations are part of the "art and science" practices from the 18th and 19th centuries. At the core of those practices were observation and interpretation, unraveling complexity through visualizing abstract ideas or finding a creative approach for understanding previously incomprehensible forms. 

I'm an admirer of two female pioneers in the field. Maria Sibylla Merian created, with immense dedication, a book with intricate illustrations of plants and insects, later praised by scientists. On the other hand, Anna Atkins published a book with beautiful botanical cyanotypes, considered the first book with photographic images. These topics are the visual inspiration for pieces presented at ArtBasel HK. 

My mathematical background makes me naturally attracted to graphs, converting numbers to curves, and everything schematically displayed. Also, combining scientific symbols and illustrations with imaginary data inspires the spectator to find meaning in unrelated or random things or provokes latent skepticism towards assumed concepts of truth, reality, and knowledge.

metadata.name: Megalopolis #172
metadata.description:
Abstract artwork that generates urban-like structures viewed from the sky.

Options:

- press 'f' to toggle noise filter
- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to save hi-res PNG images

Created using p5js.

@VolatileMoods, May, 2022.

metadata.name: Fermi paradox #1
metadata.description:
"Two possibilities exist: Either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying."

Sir Arthur C. Clarke
--

A search for extraterrestrial life using p5.js
• press [S] to save a 1600x2000 image (.png)

Designed for Chrome, tested on Edge
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA

metadata.name: Pixel Dinos #75
metadata.description:
Mint your own little dinosaur pet!..

Contains thousands of different combinations.

metadata.name: FXHASH Generative Logo #89
metadata.description:
Unique iteration of the first Generative Token minted on fxhash.

It also servers as the actual logo of the platform. It represents the generative processes driving fxhash tokens. Generative Tokens are fed with a unique hash to produce unique outputs based on the hash — they are functions with a hash as single input.

The growth that comes out of the text is driven by a "Dividing-Aggregating Walkers" (DAW) algorithm. The hash drives all the DAW settings, as well as a mutation factor which is responsible for changes in each Walker parameters as they divide.

Some iterations will produce very simple outputs whereas others might be more chaotic.

Piece by @ciphrd for fxhash

metadata.name: Mystic Paradise #23
metadata.description:
Generate your own mystic paradise. 
Here is generative pieces creating an animated skyline with a reflection .

The size, position and frequency of shapes are generated for each token, along with the color theme.  

Movements and positions are generated by a noise and a seed, it’s the same for each view.
 On live version the visual fit your screen. There is also an export menu if you press 'm' or 'e' on the live version.

Shortcuts :
    - click to play/pause the animation
    - press ‘f’ to launch the fullscreen mode
    - On live version : press ‘e’ or ‘m’ to open the export menu
    - On live version : press ‘h’ to hide the cursor

Features :
    - Number of shapes - between 50 and 310
    - Reflection type - « mirror » or « continu » 
    - Infinite reflection - true or false
    - Direction - « west » & « east » give an isometric rendering, or « straight » 
    - Length Factor is a value to manage the animated distance of each shape linked with the noise
    - Particles count - between 200 & 600
    - Visible Aura - true or false 

Created by Quentin Hocdé, in Brussels (Belgium).

metadata.name: Pixel Dinos #45
metadata.description:
